trans-unit.source: A block-level flow content element used to group content into a paragraph.
Paragraph enforces a strong content model for child content.
See [TextElement Content Model Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information about the Paragraph content model.
In addition to plain text, a Paragraph element can host other <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Inline> elements.

Valid child elements include: - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Bold> - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Figure> - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Floater> - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink> - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer> - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Italic> - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.LineBreak> - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> - <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Underline> See [Flow Document Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information on what this object can contain and what can contain it.
Initializes a new, empty instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref> class, taking a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object as its initial contents.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> object specifying the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref>.

Gets an <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection"></xref> containing the top-level <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> elements that comprise the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection> returned by this property to enumerate or manipulate the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph> element.

An <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> elements that comprise the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the text of the paragraph may be broken by a page break or column break.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to prevent the text of the paragraph from being broken; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.KeepTogether*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a break may occur between this paragraph and the next paragraph.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to prevent a break from occurring between this paragraph and the next paragraph; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.KeepWithNext*> dependency property.
To be added.

Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum number of lines that can be left before the break when a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref> is broken by a page break or column break.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
An integer specifying the minimum number of lines that can be left before the break when a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref> is broken by a page break or column break.
A value of 0 indicates no minimum.
The default value is 0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.MinOrphanLines*> dependency property.
To be added.

Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum number of lines that can be placed after the break when a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref> is broken by a page break or column break.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
An integer specifying the minimum number of lines that can be placed after the break when a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref> is broken by a page break or column break.
A value of 0 indicates no minimum.
The default value is 0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.MinWidowLines*> dependency property.
To be added.
Indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.Inlines*> property should be persisted.
This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.Inlines%2A> property does not have a simple default value.
This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value.

You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph>.
A serialization service manager object for this object.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
manager is .
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection"></xref> that contains text decorations to apply to this element.
A <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration> object is a visual ornamentation you can add to text.
There are four types of text decorations: underline, baseline, strikethrough, and overline.
For more information about text decorations, see [How to: Create a Text Decoration](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
A <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationCollection"></xref> collection that contains text decorations to apply to this element.
A value of <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> means no text decorations will be applied.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.TextDecorations*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates how far to indent the first line of a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph"></xref>.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values *double* A string representation of a value equal to or greater than 0.0 but smaller than .
An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
*qualifiedDouble* A `double` value as described above, (except `Auto`) followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`.

`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] `in` is inches; 1in==96px `cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px `pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |
A double value specifying the amount to indent the first line of the paragraph, in device independent pixels.
The default value is 0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph.TextIndent*> dependency property.
To be added.
